intro: Cliffortia leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, pea-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found on coastal cliffs and slopes, where it thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscaping.
